channel.title: Comments on: Corona Geek #35 – Hanging out with Spelling Test developer, Brian Park

item.title: By: Charles McKeever
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: Thanks Brian. Feel free to start a thread in the forum. It will be easier for everyone to keep up with and everyone else will be able to follow along :)
item.content:encoded: Thanks Brian. Feel free to start a thread in the forum. It will be easier for everyone to keep up with and everyone else will be able to follow along ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Brian Park
item.dc:creator: Brian Park
item.description:
Hi everybody, it was a lot of fun to participate in the hangout. As a side note, some users have visited my site and contacted me with questions which I've answered. Feel free to post your questions here or email brian@funexam.com and if I can help I will.
I'm happy to update everybody once the subscription service launches.
item.content:encoded:
Hi everybody, it was a lot of fun to participate in the hangout. As a side note, some users have visited my site and contacted me with questions which I’ve answered. Feel free to post your questions here or email brian@funexam.com and if I can help I will.

I’m happy to update everybody once the subscription service launches.

item.title: By: Charles McKeever
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: E Johnson and David, thank you both for watching and supporting the show. Brian did a great job telling his developer story. He also shared some great tips. It's inspiring to hear the creativity of others. My favorite part was when he talked about giving the app away for free as a marketing tool to attract customers to his online subscription service. That's a really smart idea. Maybe we can get Brian back on once he's had a chance to get the subscription piece completed.
item.content:encoded: E Johnson and David, thank you both for watching and supporting the show. Brian did a great job telling his developer story. He also shared some great tips. It’s inspiring to hear the creativity of others. My favorite part was when he talked about giving the app away for free as a marketing tool to attract customers to his online subscription service. That’s a really smart idea. Maybe we can get Brian back on once he’s had a chance to get the subscription piece completed.

item.title: By: David
item.dc:creator: David
item.description: That was a very informative video. Great job!
item.content:encoded: That was a very informative video. Great job!

item.title: By: E Johnson
item.dc:creator: E Johnson
item.description:
Charles, Thanks for bringing us another great guest this week in Brian whose app-development journey through trials and resolves is exemplary and not to be missed.
Brian, Congratulations to you and your visions and success in FunExam.com!
item.content:encoded:
Charles, Thanks for bringing us another great guest this week in Brian whose app-development journey through trials and resolves is exemplary and not to be missed.

Brian, Congratulations to you and your visions and success in FunExam.com!
